title: What is 'D3.js'?

options.b: A JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data

title: What is the primary use of D3.js?

options.b: Data visualization and manipulation in web applications

title: What does 'D3' stand for in D3.js?

options.b: Dynamic Data Design

title: What is the core concept of D3.js?

options.b: Data binding and manipulation

title: What is a 'selection' in D3.js?

options.b: A way to select and manipulate elements in the DOM

title: What does 'enter', 'update', and 'exit' represent in D3.js?

options.b: The three phases of data binding

title: What is the purpose of 'scale' in D3.js?

options.b: To create a mapping between data values and visual representation
options.d: To adjust volume in audio playback

title: What is 'domain' in the context of D3.js scales?

options.a: A set of input data values
options.b: A set of 3D coordinates

title: What is 'range' in the context of D3.js scales?

options.b: A set of output values for visual representation

title: What is the purpose of 'axis' in D3.js?

options.a: To control the rotation of 3D objects
options.b: To create reference lines and labels for visualizing data on charts
options.d: To define the axis of a 3D space

title: What is 'interpolation' in D3.js?

options.a: A way to blend colors in 3D graphics
options.b: A method for calculating values between known data points

title: What does 'transition' represent in D3.js?

options.b: A method for animating changes to selected elements over time

title: What is the purpose of 'force layout' in D3.js?

options.a: To create force fields in 3D simulations
options.b: To simulate physical forces between nodes in a network graph
options.c: To generate random forces in 3D objects

title: What does 'hierarchical layout' refer to in D3.js?

options.a: A layout for organizing 3D objects hierarchically
options.b: A method for arranging elements in a tree-like structure
options.d: A way to create hierarchical menus in 3D applications

title: What is 'geo projection' used for in D3.js?

options.b: To create map projections in cartography
options.d: To project geometric shapes in 3D modeling

title: What does 'geo path' do in D3.js?

options.b: A utility for rendering GeoJSON data as SVG paths
options.c: A path for walking in 3D games

title: What is the purpose of 'drag behavior' in D3.js?

options.b: To add interactivity to elements by allowing them to be dragged by the user
options.c: To simulate the motion of 3D objects
options.d: To control the dragging of elements in a 3D space

title: What is 'brush behavior' used for in D3.js?

options.b: To create interactive brushing and linking for selecting data points
options.c: To add brush strokes to 3D images
options.d: To simulate the motion of a brush in 3D space

title: What is the 'geospatial scale' in D3.js?

options.a: A scale for measuring distances in 3D space
options.b: A scale for mapping geospatial data to screen coordinates
options.c: A scale for adjusting the size of geographic features
options.d: A scale for measuring volumes in 3D objects

title: What is 'd3.geoZoom' used for in D3.js?

options.b: A plugin for zooming and panning geospatial data
options.c: To create a zoom effect in 3D animations

title: What is 'd3-sankey' in D3.js?

options.b: A plugin for creating Sankey diagrams in D3.js

title: What is the 'd3-quadtree' in D3.js?

options.b: A data structure for efficiently searching and managing 2D data

title: What does 'd3-tile' provide in D3.js?

options.b: A method for tiling geographic data into a grid of image tiles

title: What is 'd3-contour' used for in D3.js?

options.b: A tool for generating contour plots from 2D data
options.d: A tool for creating contour maps

title: What is 'd3-chord' in D3.js?

options.b: A plugin for creating chord diagrams in D3.js
